SILDENAFIL

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy

  • Side effects

  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Pulmonary arterial hypertension,

By intravenous injection

  • For adults
    20 mg 3 times a day.
  • For adults
    10 mg 3 times a day, use intravenous route when the oral route is not appropriate.

Erectile dysfunction,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 50 mg, to be taken approximately 1 hour before sexual activity, adjusted according to response to 25–100 mg (max. per dose 100 mg) as required, to be taken as a single dose; maximum 1 dose per day.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Use only if potential benefit outweighs risk—no evidence of harm in animal studies.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

In pulmonary arterial hypertension, if usual dose not tolerated, reduce oral dose to 20 mg twice daily and intravenous dose to 10 mg twice daily.

For erectile dysfunction, use initial dose of 25 mg.

Manufacturer advises avoid in severe impairment.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Use initial dose of 25 mg in erectile dysfunction if eGFR less than 30 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

In pulmonary hypertension, if usual dose not tolerated, reduce oral dose to 20 mg twice daily and intravenous dose to 10 mg twice daily..

Contra indications

  • Hereditary degenerative retinal disorders
  • history of non-arteritic anterior ischaemic optic neuropathy
  • recent history of myocardial infarction
  • recent history of stroke

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Back pain, dyspepsia, flushing, migraine, myalgia, nasal congestion, visual disturbances,

notKnown: Non-arteritic anterior ischaemic optic neuropathy (discontinue if sudden visual impairment occurs), sudden hearing loss (advise patient to seek medical help),

Specific side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: nausea, dizziness, vomiting, abdominal distension, alopecia, anaemia, anxiety, bronchitis, cellulitis, cough, diarrhoea, dry mouth, epistaxis, fever, gastritis, gastro-oesophageal reflux, haemorrhoids, headache, influenza-like symptoms, insomnia, limb pain, night sweats, oedema, painful red eyes, paraesthesia, photophobia, retinal haemorrhage, tremor, vertigo,

uncommon: chest pain, drowsiness, dry mouth, epistaxis, fatigue, hypertension, hypoaesthesia, hypotension, painful red eyes, palpitation, tachycardia, tinnitus, vertigo, gynaecomastia, haematuria, penile haemorrhage, priapism,

rare: atrial fibrillation, cerebrovascular accident, facial oedema, hypersensitivity reactions, priapism, rash, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, syncope,

notKnown: arrhythmia, myocardial infarction, seizures, unstable angina, rash, retinal vascular occlusion,

Advice for patients and carers

With oral use for Erectile dysfunction

Onset of effect may be delayed if taken with food.

National funding/access decisions

Cautions regarding administration

  • Active peptic ulceration
  • bleeding disorders
  • cardiovascular disease
  • left ventricular outflow obstruction
  • When used for erectile dysfunction: anatomical deformation of the penis (e.g. angulation, cavernosal fibrosis, Peyronie's disease)
  • When used for erectile dysfunction: predisposition to priapism (e.g. in sickle-cell disease, multiple myeloma, or leukaemia)
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: anatomical deformation of the penis
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: autonomic dysfunction
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: hypotension (avoid if systolic blood pressure below 90 mmHg)
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: intravascular volume depletion
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: predisposition to priapism
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: pulmonary veno-occlusive disease

Advice regarding ceasing treatment

When used for Pulmonary arterial hypertension

Consider gradual withdrawal.

Prepared medicinal forms of SILDENAFIL

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: pessary, oral suspension, oral solution,
Tablet
Chewable tablet
Oral suspension
Solution for injection
